tech.title: Next.js
tech.description: My first choice of framework to work with. My Master Thesis is built in Next.js. It was also the main tech I worked with at both my LIA´s.

tech.title: React.js
tech.description: The Javascript framework I learned in school and am very comfortable with.

tech.title: TypeScript
tech.description: Most of my React.js/Next.js projects are built with Typescript. It was also a "standard" at both my LIA´s.

tech.title: WordPress
tech.description: I learned how to create a child theme and how to build a simple WooCommerce site.

tech.title: Node.js (Express.js)
tech.description: Node.js is my preferred language in backend and is also the one I´m most comfortable with together with Next.js

tech.title: PHP
tech.description: Learned PHP at my Worpress course and also at my system development course. This is the language I have least work experience in (LIA).

tech.title: MongoDB (Mongoose.js)
tech.description: I used MongoDB at my Master Thesis and a few other projects before that. This is the database I´m most comfortable with.

tech.title: MySQL
tech.description: Learned MySQL in the beginning of my education. Did one E-commerce project with it together with PHP.

tech.title: Stripe.js
tech.description: Used Stripe.js at my Master Thesis and also another project before that. The parts I touched was "create customer", "create order", "payment" and "verification of payment"

tech.title: Cypress.io
tech.description: I learned Cypress at my LIA 1 very briefly. I can do simple tests

tech.title: BigCommerce
tech.description: At my second LIA I learned how to integrate BigCommerce with a Next.js project.
